elements.2211.03041_48c62edcfeb638268afa2b67c52dd: Calibration strengthens the trustworthiness of black-box models by producing better accurate confidence estimates on given examples
elements.2211.03041_525fd5df528fd4463483ef2d75635: However, little is known about if model explanations can help confidence calibration
elements.2211.03041_f0de70dc006448760d392e42f76af: Intuitively, humans look at important features attributions and decide whether the model is trustworthy
elements.2211.03041_2f230395a04e168be76f6513c8990: Similarly, the explanations can tell us when the model may or may not know
elements.2211.03041_962bce530dfa517ad4c41d2ebcaf0: Inspired by this, we propose a method named
elements.2211.03041_c80dba1a80842d5d97795a97980a3: that leverages model explanations to make the model less confident with non-inductive attributions
elements.2211.03041_b82f9292fde432c927467eddb1ba1: The idea is that when the model is not highly confident, it is difficult to identify strong indications of any class, and the tokens accordingly do not have high attribution scores for any class and vice versa
elements.2211.03041_de67c039067325e75bf4e3a738052: We conduct extensive experiments on six datasets with two popular pre-trained language models in the in-domain and out-of-domain settings
elements.2211.03041_5706bfc42c35bb9668f1ef43e4ebc: The results show that CME improves calibration performance in all settings
elements.2211.03041_e90948b47ef1a8e86ce20a30e59b9: The expected calibration errors are further reduced when combined with temperature scaling
elements.2211.03041_c10cef06830e3a6b15a33aff1b9c5: Our findings highlight that model explanations can help calibrate posterior estimates.
elements.2211.03041_25e94d144861ff6bd1737d140c195: Accurate estimates of posterior probabilities are crucial for neural networks in various Natural Language Processing (NLP) tasks
elements.2211.03041_11e9ce9ac1ccf710122c451fec656: For example, it would be helpful for humans if the models deployed in practice abstain or interact when they cannot make a decision with high confidence
elements.2211.03041_bb885bbae12195068dbd636c0b5f3: While Pre-trained Language Models (PLMs) have improved the performance of many NLP tasks
elements.2211.03041_42dbeea04e78cd719247f98220e4f: , how to better avoid miscalibration is still an open research problem
elements.2211.03041_e48be0e77a8ed77614b3b1e44a4be: In this paper, we investigate if and how model explanations can help calibrate the model
elements.2211.03041_c06abb1e6d88de9dcf0b179cbbd92: Explanation methods have attracted considerable research interest in recent years for revealing the internal reasoning processes behind models
elements.2211.03041_72a4a5ff33a339be49be9c00a3f2e: Token attribution scores generated by explanation methods represent the contribution to the prediction
elements.2211.03041_1e82954898d966216e51eb4572540: Intuitively, one can draw some insight for analyzing and debugging neural models from these scores if they are correctly attributed, as shown in Table
elements.2211.03041_0d27422a224686faa3591515a073c: For example, when the model identifies a highly indicative pattern, the tokens involved would have high attribution scores for the predicted label and low attribution scores for other labels
elements.2211.03041_8a5bba730315445f431b623a787bc: Similarly, if the model has difficulty recognizing the inductive information of any class (i.e., the attribution scores are not high for any label), the model should not be highly confident
elements.2211.03041_dae5f8b312ce2443999fcfa3421b3: As such, the computed explanation of an instance could indicate the confidence of the model in its prediction to some extent
elements.2211.03041_8299c796425bc1d9229408008f4a3: Inspired by this, we propose a simple and effective method named
elements.2211.03041_49f386dab2e0f455355129629e3b7: that can be applied at training time and improve the performance of the confidence estimates
elements.2211.03041_37b39938b4dab934883722779a4e5: The estimated confidence measures how confident the model is for a specific example
elements.2211.03041_fa426ad34eb426367945dc598b444: Ideally, reasonable confidence estimates should have higher confidence for correctly classified examples resulting in higher attributions than incorrect ones
elements.2211.03041_1845328056f594ec8586655ead4a6: Hence, given an example pair during training with an inverse classification relationship, we regularize the classifier by comparing the wrong example's attribution magnitude and the correct example's attribution magnitude
elements.2211.03041_86c6457fddaf149dcded57eafce42: Our work is related to recent works on incorporating explanations into learning
elements.2211.03041_5f563503daf70012d65bb674b9d6c: Different from previous studies that leverage explanations to help users predict model decisions
elements.2211.03041_ae4b6854e7e342ea1a54d7337d14d: , we focus on answering the following question:
elements.2211.03041_c5c1999d3e1ff860b5796ac27db1a: If so, how should we exploit the predictive power of these explanations? Considering the model may be uninterpretable due to the nature of neural networks and limitations of explanation method
elements.2211.03041_a6fb9e48f982141136524ff19bde5: , a calibrated model by CME at least can output the unbiased confidence
elements.2211.03041_e584c3fb7104be0b9b3aea03df3f7: Moreover, we exploit intrinsic explanation during training, which does not require designing heuristics
elements.2211.03041_1f19e332a10ada6ba11dd066ead1d: We conduct extensive experiments using BERT
elements.2211.03041_ee655de8fb1134d07253bd4929c5e: to show the efficacy of our approach on three natural language understanding tasks (i.e., natural language inference, paraphrase detection, and commonsense reasoning) under In-Domain (ID) and Out-of-Domain (OD) settings
elements.2211.03041_cede8ecb98747b9571ec115acc08e: CME achieves the lowest expected calibration error without accuracy drops compared with strong SOTA methods, e.g.,
elements.2211.03041_783f4f1a574c66c4f8624b94246f3: , the expected calibration errors are further reduced as better calibrated posterior estimates under these two settings.
elements.2211.03041_1e9a20ab42ca69bc10281b98c6ad7: A well-calibrated model is expected to output prediction confidence (e.g., the highest probability after softmax activation) comparable to or aligned with its task accuracy (i.e., empirical likelihood)
elements.2211.03041_d0d9d81bf6fc8403eb26739af0b07: For example, given 100 examples with the prediction confidence of 0.8 (or 80
elements.2211.03041_afddf436f048518c3699908aeb8cb: ), we expect that 80 examples will be correctly classified
elements.2211.03041_2197b9454f7d0d21c3e1028e3814e: , we estimate the calibration error by empirical approximations
elements.2211.03041_4ec025e6d6feb07b88567d72624b0: Specifically, we partition all examples into
elements.2211.03041_726391667d7009724a7fa8d02c3ad: bins of equal size according to their prediction confidences
elements.2211.03041_d691d8cea3d36fbdc7e4bf93e4da1: , we define the empirical calibration error as:
elements.2211.03041_5536b617b9f79fa782223a8fc2d15: are the true label, predicted label and confidence for
elements.2211.03041_8c9c56187bc5d9b4712b1965ce288: denotes the bin with prediction confidences bounded between
elements.2211.03041_cd00e96abc88ef3da2e139a69e8fe: To evaluate the calibration error of classifiers, we further adopt a weighted average of the calibration errors of all bins as the Expected Calibration Error (ECE)
elements.2211.03041_1e362bf1b073786f44973494c0a6b: is the example number and lower is better
elements.2211.03041_e124e6a6b806aacac93c3af0293ac: Note that the calibration goal is to minimize the calibration error without significantly sacrificing prediction accuracy.
elements.2211.03041_eb69487ea5d667f0f9539d63f90a3: Generally, text classification models are optimized by Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE), which minimizes the cross-entropy loss between the predicted and actual probability over
elements.2211.03041_07355bf75db5ebbc2f2a8671a3573: To minimize the calibration error, we add a regularization term to the original cross-entropy loss as a multi-task setup
elements.2211.03041_26a88df622714503e150ad3ad7535: Our intuition is that if the error of the model on example
elements.2211.03041_6d984c2a3f521d78ee99017ded823: is more significant than its error on example
elements.2211.03041_2768dced89256c2eb7f9a7408bb87: is considered more difficult for the classifier), then the magnitude of attributions on example
elements.2211.03041_8de833c9a1155b6a4136ff7cbaa05: should not be greater than the magnitude of attributions on example
elements.2211.03041_d5456990b60a4952063d6ad297ef6: Moreover, we penalize the magnitude of attributions with the model confidence
elements.2211.03041_1941957806c191ba03427187373e3: , as the high error examples also should not have high confidence
elements.2211.03041_31ade0ecf063dadd69f2d17a2510f: Compared to the prior post-calibration methods (e.g., temperature scaling learns a single parameter with a validation set to rescale all the logits), our method is more flexible and sufficient to calibrate the model during training.
elements.2211.03041_af1f3e14f5ee075a62fa05335d101: is the embeddings of input tokens and
elements.2211.03041_edbdcd907639feca9c753512d7360: is the one-hot vector corresponding to its true label, an attribution of the golden label for input
elements.2211.03041_0a1fc45846ed8fb3c0fef3986a5d8: is defined as the attribution of
elements.2211.03041_348badaf9feabc6580dc80550dc43: Here, attention scores are taken as the self-attention weights induced from the start index to all other indices in the penultimate layer of the model; this excludes weights associated with any special tokens added
elements.2211.03041_e57ee2ae9acda8de95b28e767f184: At last, our training minimizes the following loss:

elements.2211.03041_0617e1c2a41260e0b0fbeeb0f3931: In other words, we consider all pairs where

elements.2211.03041_96a544609005ed913167f44028304: Full training details are shown in Algorithm
elements.2211.03041_521f30ee0354adb76e43eead38f72: To compute the gradient w.r.t the learnable weight independently, we retain the computation graph in the first back-propagation of classification loss
elements.2211.03041_7a927fb2b0a8ac99c92fbe6646355: The model explanations are dynamically produced during training and then used to update the model parameters, which can be easily applied to most off-the-shelf neural networks.
elements.2211.03041_fa9b9dc7bf3202c15e7fbb6af7cc9: We conduct the experiments in three natural language understanding tasks under the in-domain/out-of-the-domain settings: SNLI
elements.2211.03041_5b84a6ca4e8df73f10522b1d70440: We describe all datasets in details in Appendix
elements.2211.03041_e7b57eb7dc3d73cadd88c3dfb1f64: , we consider two settings: out-of-the-box (OOTB) calibration (i.e., we directly evaluate off-the-shelf trained models) and post-hoc calibration - temperature scaling (TS) (i.e., we rescale logit vectors with a single temperature for all classes)
elements.2211.03041_464bdbcf0f94bcca788bd4fff711b: And we also experiment with Label Smoothing (LS)
elements.2211.03041_1a78a582a34f2126af2b05c44ef8b: The models are trained on the ID training set for each task, and the performance is evaluated on the ID and OD test sets
elements.2211.03041_486ddebd3f9d588c70455953d7ab0: Additionally, we present implementation details and case studies in the Appendix
elements.2211.03041_b71f3255e2ce4bd1f661a89f086c8: shows the comparison of experimental results (ECEs) on BERT and RoBERTa
elements.2211.03041_4d74fea7b07cfa8fef2f90fc159b9: First, for OOTB calibration, we find that CME achieves the lowest calibration errors in the ID datasets except for RoBERTa in SWAG
elements.2211.03041_cf45858ca5ca7459b96a9455d7ba2: At the same time, training with LS (i.e., CME+LS) exhibits more improvements in the calibration compared with original models in the TPPDB and HellaSWAG datasets
elements.2211.03041_d2978cfd7d1345e55ed703ffa49b3: However, in most cases, LS models largely increase calibration errors for ID datasets
elements.2211.03041_6021e7a9979bd145e9c677c2492cd: We conjecture that LS may affect the smoothness of the gradient and thus produces poor calibrated results
elements.2211.03041_77d74a7765155d7594115025e48e6: Secondly, for post-hoc calibration, we observe that TS always fails to correct miscalibrations of models with LS (e.g., CME-TS 0.64 vs
elements.2211.03041_2aab670e03b88604f2763f1c3e3dc: CME+LS-TS 2.16 in SNLI) under ID and OD settings
elements.2211.03041_b1ad22a5689613fe42800890a52b6: Nevertheless, TS reduces the ECEs in the OD setting by a large margin (e.g., HellaSWAG BERT 11.64
elements.2211.03041_638290dcdf4427ed58581fb2f9ad1: Compared to baselines, CME consistently improves over different tasks on calibration reduction of BERT-based models
elements.2211.03041_7db2c4c9dfad6c27adb3996fd2bcf: While we apply CME to a relatively larger model, models with TS may perform better
elements.2211.03041_babb5212e6dcabcc6fc4512badb7a: It indicates that our method can be complementary to these post-hoc calibration techniques.

elements.2211.03041_7770306d4e7861e5df0639bdbaaa5: presents the accuracy of BERT and RoBERTa on the development sets and test sets of our datasets
elements.2211.03041_83f171e7d870a00080ae9fe2e2885: Our models have comparable accuracy (even better) compared to fine-tuned counterparts
elements.2211.03041_7fd9fdaee9e00ceacb9e09772552f: For example, RoBERTa-CME has better accuracy than RoBERTa in the test set of the MNLI dataset (79.45 vs. 78.79)
elements.2211.03041_a619d96bc20409fdb6a7da46f5c4b: Specifically, CME performs poorly on the development set of HellaSWAG but performs comparably to baselines on the test set.
elements.2211.03041_aae9d1dadc9a9c26b89e29fbd3649: , we visualize the alignment between the posterior probability measured by the model confidence and the empirical output measured by the accuracy
elements.2211.03041_13d516e54950ab674b797cd412500: Note that a perfectly calibrated model has confidence equals accuracy for each bucket
elements.2211.03041_bdfa169b6d03e8c7e52e9a6b53742: Our model performs well under both PLMs architectures
elements.2211.03041_26b26a6c1141d2428f5597be4246e: We observe that, in general, CME helps calibrate the confidence of cases close to the decision boundary as it does not change most predictions
elements.2211.03041_aaa33046cedd83163796216a98dd9: For example, compared to the baseline, CME optimizes the samples whose predicted probabilities are higher than actual probabilities
elements.2211.03041_9e7b16561d2eb786dd67238234607: Moreover, we find that training with label smoothing technique can make the model underestimates some examples with high predicted probabilities
elements.2211.03041_dd0f4b417378ae1466eeec14dc622: In addition, we conducted preliminary experiments with different batch sizes, and found that more large sizes did not significantly impact calibration performance
elements.2211.03041_ef2d02f68ef19f6f0ac7138be9378: On the other hand, we found that larger LMs usually achieve both higher accuracy and better calibration performance (Table
elements.2211.03041_d78022572c1a17913635b6fc7eb4a: ), which is in line with the observation in question answering
elements.2211.03041_0167a614d9a7d791c951435d39026: As accurate estimates are required for many difficult or sensitive prediction tasks
elements.2211.03041_7b43c2232adc4a236b835b6ed9fd0: , probability calibration is an important uncertainty estimation task for NLP
elements.2211.03041_6d2e85edb61b7f456f1e11bd64395: Unlike other uncertainty estimation task (e.g., out-of-domain detection, selective inference), calibration focuses on aleatoric uncertainty measured by the probability of the prediction and adjusts the overall model confidence level
elements.2211.03041_422ae4c53b17664e831cf41312f47: propose to adopt multiple predictions with different dropout masks and then combine them to get the confidence estimate
elements.2211.03041_8cc6a3b64d65f4020dc9004172fdf: Recently, several works focus on the calibration of PLMs models for NLP tasks
elements.2211.03041_92e780ef0e4e5877e35679d11698f: investigate the calibration properties of different transformer architectures and sizes of BERT
elements.2211.03041_9a882fcf5380c9ec291ae2827099b: , our work focuses on how explanations can help calibration in three NLP tasks
elements.2211.03041_df9395d46c673cd19928796cafa38: However, we do not need to learn a calibrator by using model interpretations with heuristics, and also do not compare due to its intensive computation cost when generating attributions
elements.2211.03041_56ca6f379b20fa32b3b0afd381c57: In contrast, we explore whether model explanations are useful for calibrating black-box models during training.
elements.2211.03041_b1fac6fbb168ac83f2ac7a3bbdab6: We propose a method that leverages model attributions to address calibration estimates of PLMs-based models
elements.2211.03041_c9ded80eec9801d4a68c948a19a96: Considering model attributions as facts about model behaviors, we show that CME achieves the lowest ECEs under most settings for two popular PLMs.
elements.2211.03041_6c513f8a1b3cf6efdfa75a2ef2154: Calibrated confidence is essential in many high-stakes applications where incorrect predictions are highly problematic (e.g., self-driving cars, medical diagnoses)
elements.2211.03041_919f2626359d473216e2558217cce: Though improving the performance on the calibration of pre-trained language models and achieving the comparable task performance, our explanation-based calibration method is still limited by the reliability and fidelity of interpretable methods
elements.2211.03041_859b2cb1420e03daebfe0c2a44831: We adopt the scaled attention weight as the calculation method of attributions because (i) it has been shown to be more faithful in previous work
elements.2211.03041_c0de39ee76c292353bb4948d26705: , and (ii) the interpretation of the model is that the internal parameters of the model participate in the calculation and are derivable
elements.2211.03041_156d0b666f6a7196b0e5f3493a2a1: Despite the above limitations, it does not undermine the main contribution of this paper, as involving explanations when training helps calibrate black-box models
elements.2211.03041_aa400699b7c59a72ec56053e04254: Our approach can apply to most NLP models, incurs no additional overhead when testing, and is modularly pluggable
elements.2211.03041_4390f1a20898b885d801a0bb01a73: Another promising research direction is to explore using free-text explanations to help calibrate the model.

elements.2211.03041_dda454ca8946fbd80dcb944c67ec5: present the characteristics of all datasets
elements.2211.03041_dc6bfd14867fa020c016142d116c7: The information across the three data splits includes the average sequence length and the number of examples under each label
elements.2211.03041_8e6a9af182db5dd62695dcf6e6579: Then we briefly introduce the datasets:
elements.2211.03041_4e89e2ab7b3403b47c6b6e6fb9f2a: The in-domain dataset is the Stanford Natural Language Inference (SNLI) dataset
elements.2211.03041_aeab24d7c6c0f1a77542552132e19: It is used to predict if the relationship between the hypothesis and the premise (i.e.,
elements.2211.03041_f60212b92e25a714df9da3fd52a9a: The out-of-domain dataset is the Multi-Genre Natural Language Inference (MNLI)
elements.2211.03041_147050e193f447e31f7552fe51fb3: , which covers more diverse domains compared with SNLI.
elements.2211.03041_0f6a31c9c3e6f7e1296e5e9df2dea: The in-domain dataset is the Quora Question Pairs (QQP) dataset
elements.2211.03041_4679ed3b2b7173f5c0a000e1421b5: It is proposed to test if two questions are semantically equivalent as a paraphrase detection task
elements.2211.03041_2d30fdae121fc353162b55a199601: The out-of-domain dataset is the Twitter news URL Paraphrase Database (TPPDB) dataset
elements.2211.03041_df4236cb43a1350504a610e20fcd4: It is used to determine whether Twitter sentence pairs have similar semantics when they share URL and we set the label less than 3 as the first class, and the others as the second class following previous works.
elements.2211.03041_2fcf648012af68541d63f02dddff1: The in-domain dataset is the Situations With Adversarial Generations (SWAG) dataset
elements.2211.03041_992f2b7d86ad597124226087cc713: It is a popular benchmark for commonsense reasoning task where the objective is to pick the most logical continuation of a statement from a list of four options
elements.2211.03041_2ff13893d4beb629e953a006abc05: The out-of-domain dataset is the HellaSWAG dataset
elements.2211.03041_79ba68066123e5a074aa22cb8f0af: It is generated by adversarial filtering and is more challenging for out-of-domain generalization.
elements.2211.03041_5ad4f303ba7aa640804ad03cbaee6: For all experiments, we report the average performance results of five random seed initializations for a maximum of 3 epochs
elements.2211.03041_f0b6d908bcdb857e164ef8472561c: For a fair comparison, we follow most of the hyperparameters of
elements.2211.03041_8c623fa39c67d4344b9a302d4fb7b: For BERT, the batch size is 32 (SNLI/QQP) or 8 (SWAG) and the learning rate is
elements.2211.03041_fab757fff8c1e57f32d44df703441: , the weight of gradient clip is 1.0, and we exclude weight decay mechanism
elements.2211.03041_995b0510ddc9c358b22c1acc8ce2b: For RoBERTa, the batch size is 16 (SNLI/QQP) or 8 (SWAG) and the learning rate is
elements.2211.03041_a5185a32d5b04e1aed8feedf2e80d: , the weight of gradient clip is 1.0, and the weight decay is 0.1
elements.2211.03041_97d4a40512c420b2f51bece397504: The maximum sequence length is set to 256
elements.2211.03041_558d1be0f547d54756e7187c85e86: are 0.05 and 1.0 for BERT and RoBERTa, respectively
elements.2211.03041_8681e5bc50cac2e8c5ba15a0c5c26: We search the weight with respect to ECEs on the development sets from
elements.2211.03041_a4bf867421bc8f5d9a2ec9ce77cdd: All experiments are conducted on NVIDIA Tesla A100 40G GPUs
elements.2211.03041_7ceffd49cb3a2b9ceaf5f2d3a2d2e: We perform the temperature scaling searches in the range of [0.01,10.0] with a granularity of 0.01 using development sets
elements.2211.03041_73c0cc9fc6f8301a85ca30263b552: The search processes are fast as we use cached predicted logits of each dataset
elements.2211.03041_a4de90bc30c903406a1ea598cce70: The training time is moderate compared to the baseline
elements.2211.03041_824ba9a970084e6bf61077a4c3ab5: For example, on a A100 GPU, training the model with BERT and RoBERTa takes around 3-4 hours for QQP dataset
elements.2211.03041_cec30e01000720985dd17283b694e: For the experiments in this paper, we use
elements.2211.03041_39b99549e4c62cd2da67a10e93abb: , we find that using only confidence in Eqn.
elements.2211.03041_e0572b6016581af3b4e8d093b5eda: generally yields higher ECE than other variants
elements.2211.03041_d7d3fb5398e2fa8f38ecbab72e614: Also using attention instead of scaled attention brings an increase in errors.
elements.2211.03041_72c816a971016e4a70264a048812a: , we list randomly-selected examples of BERT-base models with MLE and CME
elements.2211.03041_723e4bd17b8446282df7ad5c82817: If models correctly predict the true label, the model confidence should be greater than 50
elements.2211.03041_a17ee7958f596edddb6fb37131e7e: For example, in the second case of out-of-domain SNLI dataset, the model confidence of true label falls slightly below the borderline probability which results in an incorrect prediction (Probabilities: 30.54
elements.2211.03041_060744114f7f6b411e20ed905b014: In contrast, CME leverages model explanation during training that helps calibrate the model confidence and predicts correctly.
elements.2211.03041_914234dde210be08788f601c64325: lists the standard deviations of each methods
elements.2211.03041_270b30f8dba8407d54cb9174687ed: We report the results across five runs with random seeds.
